strongs.metadata: Strong's Greek 4103: Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
Strong's Greek 3588: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Strong's Greek 3056: From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Strong's Greek 1487: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Strong's Greek 5100: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Strong's Greek 1984: From episkeptomai; inspection; by implication, superintendence; specially, the Christian
Strong's Greek 3713: To stretch forth, mid: To hanker after, long for, be eager for, aspire to.
Strong's Greek 2570: Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
Strong's Greek 2041: From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
Strong's Greek 1937: To long for, covet, lust after, set the heart upon. From epi and thumos; to set the heart upon, i.e. Long for.
Strong's Greek 1163: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
Strong's Greek 3767: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Strong's Greek 3588: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Strong's Greek 1985: From epi and skopos; a superintendent, i.e. Christian officer in genitive case charge of a church.
Strong's Greek 423: Irreproachable, never caught doing wrong. Not arrested, i.e. inculpable.
Strong's Greek 1510: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Strong's Greek 1520: One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
Strong's Greek 1135: A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
Strong's Greek 435: A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
Strong's Greek 3524: Sober, not intoxicated (with wine), temperate, vigilant. Or nephalios from nepho; sober, i.e. circumspect.
Strong's Greek 4998: From the base of sozo and that of phren; safe in mind, i.e. Self-controlled.
Strong's Greek 2887: Orderly, virtuous, decent, modest, well-ordered. From kosmos; orderly, i.e. Decorous.
Strong's Greek 5382: Hospitable, loving strangers. From philos and xenos; fond of guests, i.e. Hospitable.
Strong's Greek 1317: Able to teach, apt to teach. From didaktos; instructive.
Strong's Greek 3361: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Strong's Greek 3943: Given to wine, drunken, quarrelsome. From para and oinos; staying near wine, i.e. Tippling.
Strong's Greek 3361: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
Strong's Greek 4131: A striker, contentious person, brawler. From plesso; a smiter, i.e. Pugnacious.
Strong's Greek 235: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Strong's Greek 1933: Gentle, mild, forbearing, fair, reasonable, moderate. From epi and eiko; appropriate, i.e. mild.
Strong's Greek 269: Peaceable, abstaining from fighting, not contentious. Peaceable.
Strong's Greek 866: Not loving money, not avaricious. Unavaricious.
